medical_knowledge.title: Common Cold
medical_knowledge.content: The common cold is a viral infection that affects the upper respiratory tract. It is one of the most frequent illnesses that people experience throughout their lives.
treatment: Get plenty of rest to help your body fight the infection
Stay hydrated by drinking lots of fluids like water, herbal teas, and clear broths
Use a humidifier or breathe steam from a hot shower to ease congestion
Gargle with warm salt water to soothe a sore throat
Consider over-the-counter pain relievers like acetaminophen or ibuprofen for aches and pains
Throat lozenges or hard candies can help soothe throat irritation
prevention: Wash hands frequently with soap and water
Avoid touching your face, especially nose and mouth
Stay away from people who are sick
Maintain a healthy lifestyle with good nutrition and regular exercise
Get adequate sleep to keep your immune system strong
when_to_see_doctor: Persistent cough with thick, colored mucus

medical_knowledge.title: Tension Headache
symptoms: tight band sensation around the head
muscle tension in neck and shoulders
medical_knowledge.content: Tension headaches are the most common type of headache. They feel like a tight band around the head and are usually caused by stress, poor posture, or eye strain.
treatment: Apply heat or cold to head and neck
Gentle massage of temples and neck
prevention: Take regular breaks from computer work
when_to_see_doctor: Headaches become more frequent or severe
Headache with fever, stiff neck, or vision changes
Headaches that don't respond to over-the-counter medication

medical_knowledge.title: Migraine Headache
symptoms: intense, throbbing pain usually on one side
medical_knowledge.content: Migraines are intense headaches that can last 4-72 hours if untreated. They often involve throbbing pain on one side of the head and may be preceded by visual or sensory changes called aura.
treatment: Rest in a quiet, dark room
when_to_see_doctor: Severe headache unlike any you've had before
Headache with fever and stiff neck

medical_knowledge.title: Indigestion (Dyspepsia)
symptoms: feeling of fullness in upper abdomen
medical_knowledge.content: Indigestion is a feeling of discomfort in the upper abdomen often related to eating too much, too fast, or consuming spicy or fatty foods.
treatment: Avoid spicy, fatty, or acidic foods
Don't lie down immediately after eating
Stay upright for at least 2-3 hours after meals
when_to_see_doctor: Symptoms that last more than a few days

medical_knowledge.title: Gastroenteritis (Stomach Flu)
medical_knowledge.content: Gastroenteritis is inflammation of the stomach and intestines, often caused by viral or bacterial infections. It usually resolves within a few days with proper care.
treatment: Rest and avoid solid foods initially
Electrolyte solutions can help replace lost minerals
prevention: Avoid close contact with infected individuals
when_to_see_doctor: Inability to keep fluids down for 24 hours
Symptoms worsen or last more than a week

medical_knowledge.title: Acid Reflux/GERD
medical_knowledge.content: Acid reflux occurs when stomach acid backs up into the esophagus, causing irritation and discomfort. GERD is the chronic form of acid reflux.
treatment: Elevate the head of your bed
prevention: Avoid citrus, tomatoes, chocolate, caffeine, alcohol
when_to_see_doctor: Symptoms occur more than twice a week
Weight loss due to poor appetite
Chest pain with sweating or shortness of breath

medical_knowledge.title: Chronic Fatigue
medical_knowledge.content: Chronic fatigue is persistent tiredness that doesn't improve with rest. It can be caused by various factors including sleep disorders, stress, medical conditions, or lifestyle factors.
prevention: Take breaks during long work periods
when_to_see_doctor: Fatigue persists for more than 2 weeks
Fatigue with fever, weight loss, or night sweats

medical_knowledge.title: Respiratory Symptoms
medical_knowledge.content: Respiratory symptoms can range from mild coughs to serious breathing difficulties. They may indicate various conditions from simple colds to more serious respiratory issues.
prevention: Maintain good air quality at home
when_to_see_doctor: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath
Wheezing or breathing problems in children

medical_knowledge.title: Common Skin Conditions
symptoms: changes in skin color or texture
medical_knowledge.content: Skin conditions can range from minor irritations to serious conditions requiring medical attention. Many are caused by allergies, infections, or environmental factors.
treatment: Keep affected area clean and dry
prevention: Keep skin clean but don't over-wash
when_to_see_doctor: Severe itching that interferes with sleep
Changes in moles or new growths
Skin condition doesn't improve with treatment

medical_knowledge.title: Anxiety and Stress
medical_knowledge.content: Anxiety and stress are normal responses to challenging situations, but when they become excessive or persistent, they can interfere with daily life and overall well-being.
prevention: Take regular breaks from stressful activities
when_to_see_doctor: Avoiding normal activities due to anxiety
